pullRequest.body:
Add the construction of the even part of the Hurwitz zeta function (via FE pairs).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

The un-completed version, and the relation to the defining Dirichlet series, will come in a later PR, in order to keep each PR in the series a manageable size.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Hi Chris, thanks for the feedback! I've applied your suggestions (and a few more small golfs along the same lines as yours).
I just had a quick look at the rest and it all looks good to me :)
maintainer merge

Thanks!

bors merge

This is a far as I got before lunch, will come back later and look at the rest (but it all looks good!)
This is a far as I got before lunch, will come back later and look at the rest (but it all looks good!)
Apart from a few performance issues, this looks good!

This is slightly shorter and quicker (although I can't figure out how to get the formatting of the preview to look right).

```suggestion
   have : cexp (-â†‘Ï€ * I * ((I * â†‘x) + 2 * (â†‘Î¾ * I * â†‘x))) = rexp (Ï€ * (x + 2 * Î¾ * x)) := by
        ring_nf
        simp only [I_sq, mul_neg, mul_one, neg_mul, neg_neg, sub_neg_eq_add, ofReal_exp, ofReal_add,
          ofReal_mul, ofReal_ofNat]
```

```suggestion
  have h1 : I * â†‘(1 / x) = -1 / (I * â†‘x) := by
    push_cast; field_simp [hx.ne']; ring_nf; rw [I_sq]; ring_nf
  have h2 : (a' * I * x / (I * x)) = a' := by { field_simp [hx.ne']; ring_nf }
  have h3 : 1 / (-I * (I * x)) ^ (1 / 2 : â„‚) = 1 / â†‘(x ^ (1 / 2 : â„)) := by
    rw [neg_mul, â† mul_assoc, I_mul_I, neg_one_mul, neg_neg,ofReal_cpow hx.le, ofReal_div, 
      ofReal_one, ofReal_ofNat]
  have h4 : -â†‘Ï€ * I * (â†‘a' * I * â†‘x) ^ 2 / (I * â†‘x) = - (-Ï€ * a' ^ 2 * x) := by
    rw [mul_pow, mul_pow, I_sq]; field_simp [hx.ne']; ring_nf
  rw [h1, h2, h3, h4, â† mul_assoc, mul_comm (cexp _), mul_assoc _ (cexp _) (cexp _), 
    â† Complex.exp_add, neg_add_self, Complex.exp_zero, mul_one, ofReal_div, ofReal_one]
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [neg_mul, â† mul_assoc, I_mul_I, neg_one_mul, neg_neg,ofReal_cpow hx.le, ofReal_div, ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [h1, h2, h3, h4, â† mul_assoc, mul_comm (cexp _), mul_assoc _ (cexp _) (cexp _), ```

```suggestion
      congr
      ring).lift a
```
is a bit faster

```suggestion
  have hx' : I * x â‰  0 := mul_ne_zero I_ne_zero (ofReal_ne_zero.mpr hx.ne')
  have h2 : a * I * x / (I * x) = a := by
    rw [div_eq_iff hx']
    ring
```

```suggestion
  have h4 : -Ï€ * I * (a * I * x) ^ 2 / (I * x) = - (-Ï€ * a ^ 2 * x) := by
    rw [mul_pow, mul_pow, I_sq, div_eq_iff hx']
    ring
```
Together with the previous one makes the proof twice as fast. (`field_simp`  is slow here.)

```suggestion
  have (n : â„¤) : â†‘(rexp (-Ï€ * (â†‘n + a) ^ 2 * t)) =
      cexp (-â†‘Ï€ * â†‘a ^ 2 * â†‘t) * jacobiThetaâ‚‚_term n (â†‘a * I * â†‘t) (I * â†‘t) := by
    rw [jacobiThetaâ‚‚_term, â† Complex.exp_add]
    push_cast
    congr
    ring_nf
    simp only [I_sq, mul_neg, neg_mul, mul_one]
  simp only [this]
  exact (hasSum_jacobiThetaâ‚‚_term _ (by rwa [I_mul_im, ofReal_re])).mul_left _
```
Slow `convert` .

```suggestion
  have (n : â„¤) : cexp (2 * â†‘Ï€ * I * â†‘a * â†‘n) * â†‘(rexp (-Ï€ * â†‘n ^ 2 * t)) =
      jacobiThetaâ‚‚_term n (â†‘a) (I * â†‘t) := by
    rw [jacobiThetaâ‚‚_term, ofReal_exp, â† Complex.exp_add]
    push_cast
    ring_nf
    simp only [I_sq, mul_neg, neg_mul, mul_one, sub_eq_add_neg]
  simp only [this]
  exact hasSum_jacobiThetaâ‚‚_term a (by rwa [I_mul_im, ofReal_re] : 0 < im (I * t))
```
Dito.

```suggestion
    simpa only [Int.cast_add, neg_mul, Int.cast_neg, add_left_neg, ne_eq, OfNat.ofNat_ne_zero,
      not_false_eq_true, zero_pow, mul_zero, zero_mul, Real.exp_zero]
      using hasSum_ite_sub_hasSum (hasSum_int_evenKernel (k : â„) ht) (-k)
```
is faster, but longer...

```suggestion
    (â†‘(cosKernel a t) - 1) := by
  simpa using hasSum_ite_sub_hasSum (hasSum_int_cosKernel a ht) 0
```
is easier to read (one could also squeeze the `simpa` ...).
This `convert`  is also slow, but the resulting equation is maybe too long to state explicitly...

Indeed, it'd be a bit annoying to write it out. According to the profiler, about 1/3 of the total execution time for this proof is spent on two obviously absurd typeclass-inference tasks; one of them is trying to infer Subsingleton (â„• â†’ â„‚), which takes over 900 steps to fail. Unfortunately it is likely to be very hard to produce a self-contained MWE for this failure.

I've pushed a version which replaces the `convert` with an auxiliary `have` statement (which makes the proof twice as fast as before). Perhaps this auxiliary `have` should become a lemma in its own right? Something like
````
@[to_additive]
lemma HasProd.congr_fun {Î¹ M : Type*} [CommMonoid M] [TopologicalSpace M]
    {f g : Î¹ â†’ M} {m : M} (hf : HasProd f m) (h : g = f) :
    HasProd g m := 
  h â–¸ hf 
````

This lemma looks reasonable to me.
Regarding slow `convert`s, see [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/convert.20is.20often.20slow/near/433830798).

```suggestion
  congr 3 <;> ring
```
Is there a reason to call the positive real whose existence is asserted `r`  above and `p`  here?

```suggestion
    have (x : â„) : â€–(ofReal' âˆ˜ cosKernel a) x - 1â€– = â€–cosKernel a x - 1â€– := by
      rw [â† norm_real, ofReal_sub, ofReal_one, Function.comp_apply]
    simp only [this]
    exact hp'.trans (isLittleO_exp_neg_mul_rpow_atTop hp _).isBigO
```
as usual...

```suggestion
  hk := one_half_pos
```

```suggestion
  Â· rw [completedCosZetaâ‚€, WeakFEPair.symm, hurwitzEvenFEPair, smul_eq_mul, mul_one, div_div,
```
Now you can use the new congruence lemma here.
Of course. I was just waiting for CI to build all the files in between (I should probably have applied the awaiting-CI tag.) Done now.
